content:
Thunderbird shows such activity on the status bar at the bottom of the main windows and in the activity manager. Aything more is not available. It is that simple.

As you are using Linux, you might be getting a maintainer fixed version that has the status bar turned off. I understand they are not fashionable in Linux at the moment, or even with the Thunderbird developers who keep trying to get rid of the status bar as Firefox did. The whole Linux world appear to be on a minimalist user interface view for reasons I have never understood. More than 20 years in and most of the evangelism of Linux escapes me.

content:
I tempi di avvio dipendono principalmente da quanto è grande l'archivio di posta e da come è organizzato (tutto in poche cartelle o suddiviso in molte cartelle).

Dopo aver fatto un backup -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo prova a compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
creator: @next

content: ho fatto la copia della cartella thunderbird e poi , cliccando in alto a dx , non ho trovato nè preferenze nè opzioni . Comunque sono andato in impostazioni generali ed ho trovato che era impostata la compattazione automatica a 20 mb e l'ho portata a 15. Poi ho fatto manualmente la compattazione dei 4 account esistenti sulla procedura ma i tempi di apertura sono sempre gli stessi: 30 secondi. Grazie Giuseppe
creator: gi.spina

content: L'ho già scritto sopra, dipende dalla dimensione e dalla struttura dell'archivio. La compattazione permette di ridurre la dimensione dell'archivio, ma non fa miracoli.
creator: @next

content: Grazie per la risposta ma come si fa per aumentare la dimensione dell'archivio oppure ripulirlo? Giuseppe
creator: gi.spina

content:
C'è un solo modo, cancellare la posta che non serve più e poi compattare.

È anche possibile salvare una copia della posta prima di cancellarla usando ad esempio questa estensione https://addons.thunderbird.net/it/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

content:
Google have not taken over, but many providers check where you are connecting from and refuse mail connections if you did not connect to the internet using their service.

The use of VPN services has become quite wide spread, but they are not well suited to email and many simply prevent email at all. Other have workarounds for some providers and others just have to be disabled for a mail client to work.

As you have provided no information about the actually connection error all I can do is speculate. Perhaps post the error messages verbatim so we stand a chance of at least having the information you have.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Sorry. Maybe I didn't explain it properly.

I want to mark all the messages in the search folder as read but not the entire folder that the search folder is a subset of.

Let's say I've created a search folder that has the main inbox as the source. The search parameters are set to filter for all emails from microsoft.com. The search folder then fills up with all the messages from Microsoft.com. If I then try to mark that search folder with "Mark Folder Read" then it not only marks the all the messages in the Search folder as read, but everything in the inbox it's based on too.

This is very specific to Search Folders, not normal ones.

content: The recommended settings are: smtp.sfr.fr on 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address. Also allowed is: smtp.sfr.fr on 25, security = none, authentication = password, transmitted insecurely, User Name = email address, but this probably won't work when you connect to a non-SFR network.

Hola, Podrias verificar las siguientes preferencias avanzadas: Herramientas->Ajustes->General: abajo de todo botón "Editor de configuración.." luego en el campo de búsqueda escribir: security.default_personal_cert en "Ask Every Time" siempre preguntara cuando se quiere usar el certificado security.remember_cert_checkbox_default_setting en "True" solicita recordar el certificado

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Lets get this very clear. If you are asked for a primary password you have one, and you set it.

If you do not know it there are instructions here as to how to clear it, and all saved passwords.

However you will most likely not have a primary password, few do. In that case use the password manager to view and edit your passwords. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb

Note this well, refusal to connect which result in a prompts to enter a new password is rarely that. Thunderbird has not forgotten a password. It is more likely you antivirus is simply messing up the connection attempt so Thunderbird asks you to give it a working authentication password.

As you have provided basically no context. I hope this goes some way towards answering your question, because I am guessing and extrapolating based on past experience, not current information from you.
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: lordjohn

content:
It is mobile, not mobil. I hope that is a typo, or it is your problem.

Next, your interpretation of the message is not clear. Please quote the error message verbatim.

Third. It is very common for the entire account creation connection to be blocked by antivirus products that are simply interfering in the process, so if you have a product that scans email I suggest you disable it while you configure your account. If you have a VPN, most certainly you will need to disable that as it will prevent you getting mail from Spectum/charter. Spectrum/Cherter refuse connections that do not originate on their network. The whole function of a VPN is to hide the network you are connected to the internet from and pretend you are from somewhere else.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
That is a very bizarre image, the Thunderbird application is not even aligned with the start menu

Perhaps make more readable screen captures the Microsoft way. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/use-snipping-tool-to-capture-screenshots-00246869-1843-655f-f220-97299b865f6b

What I see is an inbox entirely composed of junk/spam messages. It looks a little like my Gmail spam folder really. Personally I would be using a reading pane to see the content of the messages (F8) but I don't see anything particularly nonsense, except you provider is doing a poor job on spam filtering and your junk filters in Thunderbird must be turned off for that rubbish to not be picked up as spam/junk..
